verses.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

similars.text: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)

O ye workers of iniquity; ye that are puffed up in the vain things of the world, ye that have professed to have known the ways of righteousness nevertheless have gone astray, as sheep having no shepherd, notwithstanding a shepherd hath called after you and is still calling after you, but ye will not hearken unto his voice!
For they being ignorant of God's righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.
And he did do justice unto the people, but not unto himself because of his many whoredoms; wherefore he was cut off from the presence of the Lord.
The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

I was answered that I must join none of them, for they were all wrong; and the Personage who addressed me said that all their creeds were an abomination in his sight; that those professors were all corrupt; that: "they draw near to me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me, they teach for doctrines the commandments of men, having a form of godliness, but they deny the power thereof."

Now, from this stand they did offer up, every man, the selfsame prayer unto God, thanking their God that they were chosen of him, and that he did not lead them away after the tradition of their brethren, and that their hearts were not stolen away to believe in things to come, which they knew nothing about.
The Lord then answered him, and said, Thou hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to watering?

verses.text: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

similars.text: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

For the indignation of the Lord is kindled against their abominations and all their wicked works.

similars.text: And I, Nephi, began to fear exceedingly lest the Lord should be angry with us, and smite us because of our iniquity, that we should be swallowed up in the depths of the sea; wherefore, I, Nephi, began to speak to them with much soberness; but behold they were angry with me, saying: We will not that our younger brother shall be a ruler over us.

And it came to pass that I, Nephi, being exceedingly young, nevertheless being large in stature, and also having great desires to know of the mysteries of God, wherefore, I did cry unto the Lord; and behold he did visit me, and did soften my heart that I did believe all the words which had been spoken by my father; wherefore, I did not rebel against him like unto my brothers.

And it came to pass that I began to be old; and, having no seed, and knowing king Benjamin to be a just man before the Lord, wherefore, I shall deliver up these plates unto him, exhorting all men to come unto God, the Holy One of Israel, and believe in prophesying, and in revelations, and in the ministering of angels, and in the gift of speaking with tongues, and in the gift of interpreting languages, and in all things which are good; for there is nothing which is good save it comes from the Lord: and that which is evil cometh from the devil.

verses.text: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that by my voice I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.
I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.

verses.text: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

Therefore, whoso readeth it, let him understand, for the Spirit manifesteth truth;

That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

verses.text: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

similars.text: Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

O that cunning plan of the evil one! O the vainness, and the frailties, and the foolishness of men! And they shall perish.
Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.
Now it is better that a man should be judged of God than of man, for the judgments of God are always just, but the judgments of man are not always just.
Wherefore, honest men and wise men should be sought for diligently, and good men and wise men ye should observe to uphold; otherwise whatsoever is less than these cometh of evil.

verses.text: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

verses.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.

And if he will offer unto me an acceptable offering, and acknowledgments, and remain with my people, behold, I, the Lord your God, will heal him that he shall be healed; and he shall lift up his voice again on the mountains, and be a spokesman before my face.
Wherefore, you can testify that you have heard my voice, and know my words.
And the day cometh that you shall hear my voice and see me, and know that I am.

verses.text: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

similars.text: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.
Behold, hath the Lord commanded any that they should not partake of his goodness? Behold I say unto you, Nay; but all men are privileged the one like unto the other, and none are forbidden.
I receive not honour from men.
He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose.
And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.
Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:
From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
Therefore let no man despise my servant Oliver Granger, but let the blessings of my people be on him forever and ever.
And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.

verses.text: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.

similars.text: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.
And inasmuch as they are not faithful, they shall be cut off, even as I will, as seemeth me good.
But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.
That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.
Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.
He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose.
Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the power which the Lord hath given me to edification, and not to destruction.
Now I do not write upon these plates all the words which they murmured against me. But it sufficeth me to say, that they did seek to take away my life.
For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.
But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.
